bio:
In 2015, Mobile Arts was the first company in the MENA region, to release the first mVAS application in UAE through DCB, when it was officially announced by Etisalat as the first operator to start DCB in the region. 

Since then, Mobile Arts expanded its own inhouse monetization solutions for the VAS mobile ecosystem, to be what it is today, a leading Technology Service Provider that processed over 70 million conversions offering carrier billing master aggregators, operators, advertising networks, media buyers, publishers, and content providers its turnkey platform solution aka Mobibox to achieve growth.

Mobibox solutions are developed in-house for maximum flexibility, ensuring its partners to get the most reliable service. It is available as a white label solution, enabling all mobile key players, merchants, media buyers, advertising networks, and payment providers to access to markets and grow revenues while saving time and money on development.

Mobibox features bring independence and flexibility when it comes to monetization management. Mobibox is developed as a platform as a service (PaaS) using high-end mobile technologies in user acquisition, payments, tracking and monetization to optimize best KPIs and ROI

Rabih has over 15 years experience in the Value-Added business, and as a business development manager he works closely with new clients for delivering Mobiboxs best practices accordingly to clients needs for achieving goals efficiency and access to new markets.

He also heads the expansion of Mobiboxs platform with a focus on mobile payments and the implementation of all its strategic business decisions for new partnerships with payment providers, content providers and mobile technology companies. 
He holds the degree of Master of Research specialized in Telecommunications Networks and Master in Telecommunication and Computer Engineering.

bio:
Lon is Chief Operating Officer at Sam Media. He is a true industry veteran, responsible for managing and orchestrating all internal and external communications at Sam Media. He oversees daily administrative and operational functions and is highly involved in strategic business development and carrier relations.

As a leader in innovation Sam Media is making the next generation of digital content accessible to everyone, on any device type. The company unlocks new markets with alternative payment methods and multi-platform compatibility. Sam Media has a strong focus on data science in order to improve user experience and track down fraudulent activities. 

Sam Media expanded its next-generation product line-up last year with the launch of Holozonia, the first service that offers a wide range of VR and AR content in one place. The company strongly focuses on immersive content and has already launched several VR and AR services in the past years. All these services are designed to be compatible with all types of virtual reality headsets. Even consumers who dont own a VR headset are able to engage with all the content effectively. All they need is a smartphone with internet access. This edition of World Telemedia Sam Media will surprise you again with the launch of a new spectacular XR service.

name: Nashar Sally
bio:
MessageCloud 

As a Tier One aggregator, we have direct connections to mobile operators around the globe. The result is exceptional cost-efficiency  and that means savings we can pass on to our customers. This network also creates a fast, seamless and consistent service, wherever in the world your customers might be. In addition to being a  multi-award-winning mobile messaging provider, we offer products to analyse phone numbers, verify users and accept payments by mobile.

MessageCloud Products:

Pay - Accept customer payments securely through carrier billing or SMS billing

Send - Fast, reliable SMS messaging with global reach on our powerful cloud-based platform

Verify- Authenticate customer logins and processes by SMS for secure mobile transactions

Numbers - Receive SMS messages via your own virtual mobile number or shortcode

Analyse - Access detailed data about any number worldwide with our HLR Lookup service


www.messagecloud.com

name: Louise Ford
bio:
Louise brings 30 years experience in the telecommunications industry, of which more than 20 years have been in the mobile payments and messaging sector.

In 2010, Louise relocated to Australia with a 10-year stint as Chief Executive Officer of the Oxygen8 Groups operations down under and honed her international experience, covering New Zealand and Singapore as well as Australia. During that time, she became a leading figure in the local industry as both Deputy Chair and Chair of the Aggregator and Carrier Working Groups for the Communications Alliance.

Knowledge of key regulations, including ABC and financial crime.

Throughout this time he has remained at the forefront of innovation in risk and compliance and has often been invited to provide strategic insights as a presenter at conferences. 

Responsibilities include:

	Head of Compliance: Overseeing an international team of compliance officers, developing compliance and fraud mitigation frameworks and monitoring operational effectiveness.
	Built a compliance function; from designing the strategy and target operating model to recruiting a new team and instilling a culture of operational excellence
	Designing and implementing processes to identify, monitor and report on compliance & fraud
	Developing compliance frameworks and auditing against defined standards to prevent fraud

	Strategic view of industry compliance including identifying new market risks and fraud methods

name: Jessica Pias
bio:
Jessica is Senior Compliance and Fraud Manager with MCP Insight Ltd. Ms. Pinas joined MCP in 2016. She is responsible for reviewing and evaluating compliance and fraud program areas with the goal of continuous quality improvement. In this capacity, she has developed significant skills to ensure MCP remains industry leading in its ability to monitor for advertising and payment fraud across various digital channels  a self- proclaimed data geek. Having started at MCP as Country Manager for Spain and Italy, this role has enabled Jessica to focus on her deep understanding of digital advertising and frauds associated with the affiliate value chain. Jess heads up a team of 8 fraud specialist (Special Operations Execs) whose main job is to identify fraud, analyse the Packet Capture data, understand how it is distributed to consumers and assess the value chain to identify who profits from fraud. This data is critical to understanding fraud structures and maintaining MCP's place as a leading mobile fraud specialist company.

Prior to her employment with MCP, Jessica specialized in media buying serving as Affiliate Manager for DQ&A Media Group, Mobile Advertising manager (Spain and Portugal) with the mobile service provider Tekka and Media Buyer at Waiads. Ms Pinas lives in Madrid, Spain and holds a bachelor degree in science and the NCSC certification for Cyber Essentials.

name: Thomas Tinker
address: The Granary - 1 Waverley Lane - Farnham - GU9 8BB
bio:
I help our customers get the most out of their MCP services, often becoming an extension of their teams by helping with research and other activities when time is short. Having previously worked for a content service provider I understand the challenges and desires faced by companies in the industry, tailoring our services to their requirements.

MCP Insight makes the mobile payments industry a safer space to grow your brand.

MCP is a leader in market intelligence, fraud prevention and regulatory risk management for the mobile payments space, were trusted by brands across the entire mobile ecosystem. MCPs solutions protect revenue, protect your customers and protect your brand.

Our services help our clients monitor, manage and protect the entire customer journey, from advertising campaigns, to landing page, payment page and billing. We give you the visibility and insights you need to increase conversions and protect your brand and customers from fraudulent activities. Our services include:

MCP TRENDS: Benchmark advertising campaigns against competitors and monitor market trends in over 30 territories.
MCP SCANNER: Advertising compliance monitoring to identify breaches and fraudulent activities.
MCP SHIELD: Real-time detection and blocking of fraudulent payment transactions.
MCP VERIFY: 3rd party consent verification and recording of the user journey on landing, PIN and payment pages.
MCP NET: Risk management and revenue optimisation for Mobile Operators and Aggregators

We understand the value of brand protection, regulatory compliance and consumer protection  whilst still helping our clients make money.

MCP Insight has operations across Europe, Asia, Australia, Africa, North America and the Middle East.

name: Jarvis Todd
address: Virginia Cottage, Nash Lane, Scaynes Hill, West Sussex
bio:
The Telemedia industry has pioneered the concept of revenue sharing on billable network traffic generated through consumer responses and interactions with identifiable media and marketing sources. This is now widely understood to be the best commercial model for interactive digital services or value added services (VAS) and also provides the mechanism whereby premium content and mobile applications can be monetised. Jarvis has been involved with exclusively providing business media services to this global Telemedia industry since 1995.

Having graduated from the University of London, he was initially appointed Sales Director for Europe Media Ltd, progressing to a full board role and eventually becoming the owner and CEO of World Telemedia Ltd when the business was acquired from CMP in 1998.

Jarvis and his team now produce a successful programme of internationally acclaimed World Telemedia events along with pop up projects such as #unofficialMWC2020 / 8.1LIVE. Publishing activities include, Telemedia Magazine (printed each quarter), Telemedia News (bimonthly digital) and Telemedia Viewpoint  a webinar and video content service thats hosted on their leading news and information portal - TelemediaOnline.co.uk.

In 2020 the Myth Buster series of white papers was added to the portfolio; with the specific aim of making the case for deploying carrier billing and related engagement technologies across twelve key vertical market sectors. 
 
More recently Jarvis has been committed to championing the telemedia industry across LinkedIn and now regularly attracts over 20,000 views per week from his posts.

24 Seven are in a league of their own when it comes to operating specialist IVR services.
